instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2009 backlight issues
threads.message:
Hi everyone,
The iMac had a problem with the display panel's backlight, after a few minutes of usage the display went black.
After an inverter board and the display panel were replaced the problem persists. Any ideas?

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2009 backlight issues
threads.message: I have had the PSU cause issue, but it can also be the GPU. Is it really the backlight that goes out or just the whole screen goes off?

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2009 backlight issues
threads.message: It's only the backlight, you can see the picture when you light the display with a flash light. So I'll check it with a replacment PSU then

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2009 backlight issues
threads.message: Curious if the power supply fixed this unit?

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2009 backlight issues
threads.message: Very common issue with the LED strips inside the LCD. Completely rip apart the LCD, take out the 2 LED strips and reflow every LED and the connector.

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2009 backlight issues
threads.message: I will ask the customer if they approve,  very strange I have 2 of these iMacs in the shop with similar problems....

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2009 backlight issues
threads.message: That's why I said it is VERY common. 2010 and later are a lot better but it still happens.
